release.action: Description about the action.
Added method Environment.reload() to reload the caas.conf file
Changed the way organizations are retrieved: using the SearchLDAP now
Added support for all type of connection points
Added the option to specify the node number on which a service container should run
Merged the latest code from the GITHub repository in the 2.x branch. This includes the removal of the term 'PackageManager'. It is now called ConfigurationManager.
Added an XML namespace to the template file. Also added a schema file for validating Caas configuration manager files.
Fixed a bug when creating a user: the description was not set
Added the option to specify via a -D option where to find the caas.conf. The name of the option is caas.conf.location. You need to specify the full location to the file. Example: c:/temp/mycaas.conf
Added support for accessing the teams and user assignments from the Organization object. Look at the listteams.groovy example script for usage.
Fixed a bug in the creation of a user via the caascm template. It was not creating the authenticated user correctly.
Bugfix for the connection point when it is exported via the Configuration Manager. The type was set to socket:// instead of just socket
Fixed a bug in the version number
Changed the caas.cmd file a bit to be more flexible
Added 2 sample scripts: 1 to get all the CAP packages that are currently loaded on a system and 1 script to upload and deploy all CAPs in a certain folder.
Fixed a bug in the packages list. It did not obey whether or not the server supports OLD.
For each user in an organization it was executing a call to the GetLDAPObject because the 'organizational users' entry is not mapped to an LDAP object. This is now removed.
When debug is enabled it will log the response times of all the requests. The category is caas.http
Removed all the direct System.out calls. They are now through Log4J.

Added the option to layer the system.properties that are used in the template.
You can have system-org-user.properties, system-org.properties, system-user.properties and system.properties

Added the option to 'layer' the configuration properties. In the folder where you have the caas.conf you can also have a file caas-user.conf with customizations. This is usefull if you want to have the systems in Subversion, but not usernames/passwords.
Reading the assignment root only when requested instad of when the organization is loaded.
If the organization anme contained a space and OLD was enabled the URL construction failed.
Optimized the reverseSubstibute method to be much less memory consuming.
The package list was displaying the wrong package information for ISVPs
The package list and package definiton have been combined into a single entity called Package.
Added support for viewing the Worklists and which users can act on this worklist. Also which worklist below to which teams
Removed most of the System.out.println and replaced them with Environment.info
If a CAP package was already loaded, but also a new version is available you could not get the details of the loaded package.
Added the option -c to the cm template and the cm create sub commands. This option allows to specify which components need to be exported from Cordys.
When a service group is updated using the template the configuration of the service group was not updated. This is fixed.
A bug in the package detection of a web service interface when creating a template. It would display the system name instead of the proper package name.
A bug in the Organization.call(String). It did not pass on the organizational context.

Moved the caas cm template and caas cm create commands to a separate command to emphasize the difference in use case between the 2. So now please use the 'caas template create' (to create a template file from an organization) command and the 'caas template apply' (to apply a template file to an organization) for template based actions.
Added some additional debug logging when applying a template
Fixed a NullPointer in case the package could not be found
Added a new jar in the lib folder called caas-nogroovy.jar. This jar does not contain the link to the groovy.jar. THis is to accomodate running scripts directly from Eclipse using the Groovy plugin.
Added a longer timeout for the PackageList, because the GetDeployedCapPackages can take a long time.

Added the possibility to add a strategy to to the service groups. This allows you to add a cloning-strategy to a service container so that it will automatically clone service containers based on the chosen strategy.
Added variable sys.user.name to be used in case you need the username used for the Cordys connection.
Changed the way the template reverse substitution is done. Now the logic will only look at text (either element text or attribute text) so that the replacement should not result in invalid XML.
When in a cluster a node is not turned on Caas would not start because it would try to read the installation folder. This is fixed.
Fixed an issue when trying to delete an entry while it was not loaded.
Changed the way that Caas determines the machines in the Cordys install. Previously it would examine all organizations for service containers. now it only looks at the system organization
Added a new system parameter for the template manager: sys.sys.currentdate. This is filled with the date / time on which the script is run.
Added support for BOP 4.3.
